result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Reimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $750 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Christopher L Reimer in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement. Court questions 
Defendant on change of plea. Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant. Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea. Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense makes sentencing recommendations (not joint). Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Christopher L Reimer in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions where matter is at. Atty Reetz indicates this matter is proceeding to trial at this time. Court advises this matter is in the #2 position. Atty Reetz would like any motions that State may file be heard before trial so he can prepare for trial. If State files any motions it will be within the next week. Court would like to know by noon on Friday, 9/23/16 if matter is resolved.  Bond remains in effect.
